### CGGS S.W. Laurier Refit

#### Government of Canada, Public Works and Government Services Canada
#### Solicitation Number: F7049-220181/A

**Project Overview**

The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires a contractor to perform the ship refit of the Canadian Coast Guard Ship (CCGS) S.W. Laurier. This project will involve refitting the CCGS S.W. Laurier alongside a dry dock. The contractor will be responsible for ensuring that all work is completed to the satisfaction of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.

**Bidder Instructions and Requirements**

Bidder instructions and requirements are outlined in the solicitation documents provided on the Canada Buyandsell website. Suppliers interested in submitting a bid must be aware of the associated Technical Specifications, Inspections, Tests, and Trials, and Project Management Services as outlined in the Statement of Work.

**Tendering Process**

This procurement follows the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and is exempt from NAFTA and WTO-AGP. Suppliers will be selected based on the lowest or lower bid submitted. Suppliers must have a valid Procurement Business Number (PBN) before contract award.

**Project Timeline**

Work must commence on January 17, 2023, and be completed by April 11, 2023. By submitting a bid, the Bidder certifies that it has sufficient material and human resources available to complete the project within the given timeline.

**Electronic Bid Submission**

This procurement allows bidders to submit their bid electronically through the epost Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation. For more information, please refer to Part 2 of the solicitation documents.

**Debriefing**

Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process within 15 working days of receipt of the results. Debriefings may be conducted in writing, by telephone, or in person.

**Contact Information**

Contracting Authority: Eric Zwarich
Email: [eric.zwarich@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:eric.zwarich@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)
Phone: (250) 661-2347

**Attachments**

The solicitation documents and attachments can be found on the Canada Buyandsell website.
